column1: ; CBECC Batch Processing - Run Set Definitions

column2: ; Batch Run Set Format Version ID

column1: Run each T24N project in every CZ w/ CZ appended to output filename (last updated 11/18/20)

column3: used to describe which file(s), residing in the batch Input directory (& subdirectories), that are to be processed
with data described on this row of the run set table. For example:

column4: processes ALL input files using this run set row
processes only the input files with this name
Processes all input files whose names begin with "XYZ" (case insensistive)

column3: used to identify a specific subdirectory used to process & save the output batch runs to (for this run set row)
(leaving blank means Output project files will be stored in the main Output directory specified in the batch inputs)
used to specify the output batch run filename (for this run set row)
when beginning w/ ellipsis ('…'), the text specified will be APPENDED to the default output filename
(leaving blank means Output project files will be the same as the Input files specified in the batch inputs)
Note:  If BOTH B & C columns are left blank then output projects will overwrite each other anytime multiple
input files are processed for a run set row
Data (numeric, strings or left blank) that feed into the changes made to each model processed for this run set
row (as referenced in AnalysisAction table below)

column7: ;   <<-- Column titles referenced in 'Run Set Table Column' of AnalysisAction table below

column3: Type - used to describe how a model is changed using data specified out in column F of this table

column4: floating point data stored in the Run Set table above (labeled in col F) is posted to the building database
integer data stored in the Run Set table above (labeled in col F) is posted to the building database
character string data stored in the Run Set table above (labeled in col F) is posted to the building database
char string data stored in the Run Set table above (labeled in col F) is APPENDED to the building database
Run Set table above (labeled in col F) contains the Name of a look-up table (CSV) file to be loaded into the active ruleset
Run Set table above (labeled in col F) contains the Name of a rulelist file to be loaded into the active ruleset
Run Set table above (labeled in col F) contains the Name of a rulelist to be evaluated on the building model
Note:  *PathFile data can include full paths or, if no path is specified, then these files should be located in the
batch input file or run set definitions directory

column3: AnalysisPhase - at what phase of analysis should the run set data/rules be applied to the building model
BeforeAfterPhase - more specifics about when the run set data/rules are to be applied to the building model
Note:  BeforeAfterPhase options are dependent on the AnalysisPhase options (in col B)
Obj:Prop - identity of the object type & property modified using the run set-defined data
Obj to alter - the name of the object to be altered (w/ run set data)
Note:  columns D & E used only for Set* and Append* AnalysisAction types
Run Set Table Column - label used to identify which column of data in the run set table to reference
